byline.contributor: Andrew Jacobs reported from Brasília, and Vinod Sreeharsha from Rio de Janeiro. Paula Moura contributed reporting from Brasília.
byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and VINOD SREEHARSHA

abstract: Vote to impeach Pres Dilma Rousseff sparks celebration in Brazil's Congress, but move is unlikely to end turmoil; Zika epidemic is spreading, inflation is running at 10 percent, unemployment is at seven -year high and economy is contracting.
lead_paragraph: On Monday, Brazilians awoke to the sobering reality that the political and economic turmoil that has consumed their country for the past two years is far from over.

headline.main: Vote to Impeach Rousseff Prompted Cheers, But Won’t End Turmoil in Brazil
headline.print_headline: Impeachment Vote Sparked Celebrations, but It Won’t End the Turmoil in Brazil

snippet: On Monday, Brazilians awoke to the sobering reality that the political and economic turmoil that has consumed their country for the past two years is far from over.
